intro: Oligochaetochilus ciliatus, commonly known as the ciliated moss fern, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, closely packed leaves and a specialized structure for water retention. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually covered with minute, ciliate hairs, which aid in reducing water loss. Oligochaetochilus ciliatus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
